newsitem.title: USA: FOB Gulf Grain-Corn nearby offer slips, soy steady.
newsitem.headline: FOB Gulf Grain-Corn nearby offer slips, soy steady.

text.p: U.S. FOB Gulf corn basis values remained slightly weaker in the nearby February position while soybean offers were unchanged, U.S. export sources said.
Hard red winter wheat values were steady to lower.
Dealers on Friday cited a lack of export activity and very little movement in export channels.
In export news, Philippine companies bought 40,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for March shipment at prices from $153 to $180 per tonne FOB for various grades, Manila traders said.
Also, Lebanon will tender for 35,000 tonnes of U.S. hard red winter wheat for the end of March delivery.
CORN (No. 3 yellow, FOB, U.S. Gulf, basis CBOT, cts/bu) -
-- Bid Chng Offer Chng
Feb 10-28 unq + H nc +36 + H dn 2
FH March unq + H nc +30 + H unc
LH March unq + H nc +29 + H unc
April unq + K nc +28 + K unc
May unq + K nc +27 + K unc
June unq + N nc +27 + N unc
Note: H=CBOT March, K=CBOT May, N=CBOT July, nc=no comparison.

((Chicago newsdesk 312-408-8720))
